thread.title: Beaming Zoe Ball swaps Fatboy for toyboy as snaps show Strictly star with younger new man
thread.title_full: Beaming Zoe Ball swaps Fatboy for toyboy as snaps show Strictly star with younger new man

author: Halina Watts
title: Beaming Zoe Ball swaps Fatboy for toyboy as snaps show Strictly star with younger new man
text:
Celebs Beaming Zoe Ball swaps Fatboy for toyboy as snaps show Strictly star with younger new man The TV presenter, 46, is dating Billy Yates, 40, who is 13 years younger than her ex Fatboy Slim, 53 Share Zoe Ball has been spotted with new man Billy Yates, an Antiques Roadshow cameraman, moving home in south London (Photo: FameFlynet UK) Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Zoe Ball has a smile back on her face now she is dating an Antiques Roadshow cameraman. 
The TV host, 46, is romancing Billy Yates, 40, who is 13 years younger than her ex Fatboy Slim, 53, after meeting through friends at the Beeb. 
The presenter has been on a string of jaunts with bespectacled Yates, who is six years her junior. 
They got together just a few months after Zoe split from her DJ hubby Norman “ Fatboy Slim ” Cook, 53. Zoe helps Billy move into a new flat last week (Photo: FameFlynet UK) Zoe and Billy (Photo: FameFlynet UK) 
And our exclusive pictures show Zoe, who hosts Strictly Come Dancing spin-off It Takes Two, is back on top form. 
She looked blissfully happy as she helped Antiques Roadshow cameraman Billy move gear into his new flat. 
And her family yesterday welcomed the effect the budding romance has had on the star. Zoe and Billy enjoy a tender moment in Kensington (Photo: FameFlynet UK) Zoe and Billy kissing last week (Photo: FameFlynet UK) The couple looked cosy in Kensington (Photo: FameFlynet UK) 
Zoe’s TV celebrity dad Johnny, 78, said: “We are very happy that she is finding a new lease of life. She is very happy at the moment, she really is, and that is lovely.” 
Our pictures show Radio 2 presenter Zoe looking radiant as she helped with Billy’s house move in South London. 
She stayed at the flat for three nights last week. Zoe Ball (Photo: FameFlynet UK) Billy Yates (Photo: FameFlynet UK) Read More Zoe Ball sends love to everyone who has supported her as she celebrates six months sober 
Zoe wore all black – her trademark colour – and beamed happily as she carried a table lamp from a van. 
Billy, meanwhile, was in a pink T-shirt, black flat cap and had his trousers tucked in to chunky brown boots. 
The pair have made no secret of their affection, earlier sharing a kiss in the street while enjoying a day out near Kensington Palace – which was home to Princess Diana – in central London. Zoe carrying items into the property (Photo: FameFlynet UK) Billy Yates (Photo: FameFlynet UK) Zoe lifting items into the home (Photo: FameFlynet UK) 
Zoe’s new relationship comes after she and Norman announced their 17-year marriage was over. 
After helping with the move Zoe returned alone to her South Coast home for the weekend. 
She lives in Hove, East Sussex, on the same street as ex-hubby Norman – who she pledged to remain friends with when they announced their split last year. 
A source said: “It has been a tough time for Zoe but she’s smiling again and is very happy. 
“She is in a great place now and very happy with Billy. They get on really well and are very close. They are virtually inseparable at the moment.” Zoe Ball and Billy Yates (Photo: FameFlynet UK) 
Two weeks ago the pair were seen kissing after getting out of a taxi in London. They appeared deep in conversation before Zoe hugged her new man, whispered in his ear and repeatedly kissed him. 
One onlooker said: “They looked like a new couple who are besotted with each other. 
“Zoe couldn’t stop smiling and was very into him, they look great together.” Zoe giving directions during the move (Photo: FameFlynet UK) 
It is believed the pair met several months ago when they were introduced through mutual friends at the BBC. 
As well as Antiques Roadshow, Billy has worked on a string of TV shows including ITV’s The Xtra Factor. He runs Billy Yates Media which has just £123 in funds. 
That is in stark contrast to the fortune of Zoe’s ex Norman, who was once worth an estimated £18million. Norman found fame as bassist with The Housemartins before becoming a megastar as a party DJ. Zoe with the removal truck (Photo: FameFlynet UK) 
On his Twitter page Billy describes himself as an “award-winning pickled egg scoffer, booze quaffin, part-time lady sniffing, solver of life’s everyday problems.” 
He doesn’t have children and moved out of his parents house in Darwen, Lancs, in 2004. Zoe split with Norman when it was claimed she tired of the DJ’s teetotal lifestyle. 
The pair announced “with great sadness” that they were separating in August. Zoe Ball and Billy Yates (Photo: FameFlynet UK) 
They tweeted: “After many exciting ­adventures we have come to the end of our rainbow. We’re still great friends and will continue to support each other and raise our beautiful children together living next door but one.” 
cracks 
The couple have two children, 16-year-old Woody and six-year-old Nelly. 
But cracks in the relationship started to appear when Zoe was snapped snogging 22-year-old boyband singer Tay Tay at a Strictly Come Dancing Christmas party back in December 2015. 
The singer, who is part of pop group Franklin Lake, claimed his kiss played no part in her marriage split. Zoe Ball and Billy Yates during the move in south London last week (Photo: FameFlynet UK) 
He said: “Zoe wasn’t happy in her marriage and she decided to cheat. I bet I wasn’t the first or the last. If that drunken kiss was one of the catalysts that ended her marriage then it’s not my issue. 
“She was being a cheat so it’s a good thing for them both to go their separate ways.” 
But this week Tay Tay told the Sunday Mirror: “I wish Zoe well in her new relationship.” 
Following their split it was claimed Norman had been left devastated by the break-up and was hoping for a reconciliation. Read More 'That was my son!' Zoe Ball caught chatting on mobile while presenting It Takes Two 
Insiders told how the DJ – who she wed in 1999 at Babington House, Somerset – “adores” Zoe and has always put their “family first”. 
In 2003 Zoe was forced to admit she was out of control after she was caught cheating on Norman with DJ Dan Peppe. Zoe Ball and Norman Cook (Photo: Getty) 
She said: “I wasn’t happy. And what I’ve always done in my past when life hit a rocky patch was just run from trouble into the next relationship. 
“I’ve had so many boyfriends and that’s what happened if it ever got difficult.” 
Norman forgave her but it wasn't until 2009 that Zoe put her party days behind her. 
Following a three-day New Year’s bender she described as “total carnage”, she cut back on her drinking. 
Despite their split last year Zoe continued living two doors away from Norman. The couple have two properties on a millionaire’s row in Hove. 
They bought the second from Sir Paul McCartney’s ex-wife Heather Mills, 49, for £2.75million in 2012. Zoe was once known for her hard partying (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
Zoe decided to quit drink altogether last year and over Christmas had cause to celebrate after remaining sober for six months. 
She took to Instagram took to congratulate herself on the milestone, posting an inspiring message aimed at those who pulled her through the tough times. 
She said: “Not always easy but feels good #gratitude #sobriety #calmness #strength #justfortoday #love. #merrychristmastome. 
“Love & gratitude to some special people who have helped me stay strong.” 
Zoe started fronting Strictly Come Dancing’s spin-off show in 2011. 
Taking part as a contestant in the BBC1 show in 2006 is what she says “helped people see me as more of a lady”. 
Though she later admitted the dance show had left her with a “clicky hip”. 
Last night Zoe and Norman refused to comment. 
And when asked about her son’s relationship with Zoe Ball, Billy’s mum politely said: “We have nothing to say.” Like us on Facebook
